01. Give Me The Good Earth

--------------------------------------
**320 KBPS CBR
**Cover Art
--------------------------------------------------
 Manfred Mann's Earth Band are an English rock band formed by South African musician Manfred Mann. The band's hits include covers of Bruce Springsteen's "Blinded By The Light" and "Spirit In The Night". After forming in 1971 and despite a short hiatus in the late 80s/early 90s, the Earth Band has continued to perform and tour through the present.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
The Good Earth is an album released in 1974 by Manfred Mann's Earth Band.
 Track 1 was originally done by Gary Wright on his second solo-album, while tracks 2 and 3 are originally by Australian progressive rock band Spectrum.

Early owners of one copy of this album were entitled to rights over one square foot of the earth situated at Llanerchyrfa in the County of Brecon, Wales in Great Britain. The inner sleeve included a coupon that had to be sent for registration. This was part of the promotion activities linked to the album that had ecological inspirations. There was no swindle and thousands of fans were registered. Registration could be done on or before 31 December 1975.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Personnel:


Manfred Mann: keyboards
Mick Rogers : guitars, vocals
Chris Slade: drums
Colin Pattenden: bass guitar
